snippet: The ET-Plus, made by Trinity Industries and suspected of malfunctioning during crashes, will be tested by a research organization in San Antonio.
abstract: Federal Highway Administration has accepted Trinity Industries' plans for testing highway guardrail products that are suspected of malfunctioning during crashes and potentially slicing through vehicles, even as lawmakers and lawyers criticize their adequacy.

byline.original: By DANIELLE IVORY and AARON M. KESSLER

lead_paragraph: The ET-Plus, made by Trinity Industries and suspected of malfunctioning during crashes, will be tested by a research organization in San Antonio.

headline.main: U.S. Accepts Trinity’s Plan to Test Design of Guardrail
headline.print_headline: U.S. Accepts Trinity’s Plan to Test Design of Guardrail
